00031 #include <vector>
00032 #include "../common/common.h"
00033 #include "../common/experiment.h"
00034 #include "../common/ipc.h"
00035 #include "../common/poptmx.h"
00036 #include "../common/kernel.h"

00038 
00039 using namespace std;
00040 
00041 
00043 struct clargs {
00044   Path command;               
00045   IPCprocess::Component contrast; 
00046   Path z0_list;                         
00047   Path zD_list;                         
00048   float dd;                     
00049   float alpha;                  
00050   float lambda;                 
00051   float dist;                   
00052   float dgamma;                 
00053   string slicedesc;                             
00054   Path outmask;                         
00055   Filter filter_type;           
00056   Dcenter center;               
00057   unsigned nof_threads;         
00058   bool beverbose;                               
00059   bool SaveInt;                                 
00060 
00062   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]);
00063 };
00064 
00065 
00066 clargs::
00067 clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) :
00068   contrast(IPCprocess::PHS),
00069   z0_list(""),
00070   dd(1.0),
00071   alpha(0.0),
00072   lambda(1.0),
00073   dgamma(1.0),
00074   outmask("sino-<input list>-@.tif"),
00075   SaveInt(false),
00076   nof_threads(0),
00077   beverbose(false)
00078 {
00079 
00080   poptmx::OptionTable table
00081         ("Forms IPC-based sinogram(s).",
00082          "Performs following procedures:\n"
00083          "1) reads text file(s) describing the array(s) of input files (foreground-background"
00084      " pairs) in contact print plane and at a distance from the object.\n"
00085          "2) removes the backgrounds in accordance with these files.\n"
00086          "3) performs the IPC extraction of the requested contrast component.\n"
00087          "4) constructs the sinograms of the slices requested in the slice string.");
00088 
00089   table
00090         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "ARGUMENTS:")
00091         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &zD_list, "far-intensity", "List of input images taken at the distance.", "")
00092         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &z0_list, "0-intensity", "List of input images taken in the contact print plane"
00093          " (clean absorption contrast).", "", "NONE")
00094         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "", "Arguments \"" + table.desc(&zD_list) + "\" and \"" + table.desc(&z0_list)
00095          + "\". " + AqSeries::Desc)
00096 
00097         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "OPTIONS:")
00098         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &outmask, 'o', "out",
00099                  "Output result mask.", MaskDesc, outmask)
00100         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &contrast, 'C', "contrast",
00101                  "Type of the contrast component.",
00102                  "The component of the contrast to extract"
00103                  " and then reconstruct. " + IPCprocess::componentDesc, toString(contrast))
00104         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &dist, 'z', "distance", "Object-to-detector distance (mm)",
00105          "More correctly the distance from the contact print plane and the detector plane where the image"
00106          " given by the argument " + table.desc(&zD_list) + " was taken. " + NeedForQuant)
00107         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &dd, 'r', "resolution", "Pixel size of the detector (micron)",
00108          NeedForQuant, toString(dd))
00109         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &alpha, 'l', "alpha", "The alpha-parameter of the MBA.", "", toString(alpha))
00110     .add(poptmx::OPTION, &lambda, 'w', "wavelength", "Wavelength of the X-Ray (Angstrom)",
00111          "Only needed together with " + table.desc(&alpha) + ".", toString(lambda))
00112         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &dgamma, 'g', "gamma", "Gamma coefficient of the BAC.",
00113          "Must be a value around 1.0 (theoretical).", toString(dgamma))
00114         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &slicedesc, 's', "slice",
00115                  "Slices to be processed.", SliceOptionDesc, "<all>")
00116         .add(poptmx::OPTION,   &center, 'c', "center",
00117                  "Variable rotation center.", DcenterOptionDesc, toString(0.0))
00118         .add(poptmx::OPTION,   &filter_type, 'f', "filter",
00119                  "Filtering window used in the CT.", FilterOptionDesc, filter_type.name())
00120         .add(poptmx::OPTION,   &nof_threads, 't', "threads",
00121                  "Number of threads used in calculations.",
00122                  "If the option is not used the optimal number is"
00123                  " calculated automatically.", "<auto>")
00124         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &SaveInt,'i', "int",
00125       "Output image(s) as integer.", IntOptionDesc)
00126         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00127         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00128 
00129   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00130         exit(0);
00131   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00132         table.usage();
00133         exit(0);
00134   }
00135 
00136   command = table.name();
00137 
00138   // <minus list> and <plus list> : required arguments.
00139   if ( ! table.count(&zD_list) )
00140         exit_on_error(command, "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&zD_list)+".");
00141 
00142   if ( ! table.count(&outmask) )
00143         outmask = upgrade(outmask, "reconstructed-"+zD_list) + "-@.tif";
00144   if ( string(outmask).find('@') == string::npos )
00145         outmask = outmask.dtitle() + "-@" + outmask.extension();
00146 
00147   if ( ! table.count(&contrast) )
00148         exit_on_error(command, "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&contrast)+".");
00149 
00150   if ( ! table.count(&dist) )
00151         exit_on_error(command, "Missing required option: "+table.desc(&dist)+".");
00152   if (dist <= 0.0)
00153         exit_on_error(command, "Zero or negative distance (given by "+table.desc(&dist)+").");
00154   dist /= 1.0E3; // convert mm -> m
00155 
00156   if (dd <= 0.0)
00157         exit_on_error(command, "Zero or negative pixel size (given by "+table.desc(&dd)+").");
00158   dd /= 1.0E6; // convert micron -> m
00159 
00160   if ( abs(dgamma)>=1.0 ) // should set even smaller limit
00161         exit_on_error(command, "Absolute value of gamma (given by "+table.desc(&dgamma)+")"
00162                   " is greater than 1.0.");
00163 
00164   if (lambda <= 0.0)
00165         exit_on_error(command, "Zero or negative wavelength (given by "+table.desc(&lambda)+").");
00166   if ( table.count(&lambda) && ! table.count(&alpha) )
00167     warn(command, "The wavelength (given by "+table.desc(&lambda)+") has influence only together"
00168          " with the alpha parameter (given by "+table.desc(&alpha)+").");
00169   if ( ! table.count(&lambda) && table.count(&alpha) )
00170     warn(command, "The wavelength (given by "+table.desc(&lambda)+") needed together with"
00171          " the alpha parameter (given by "+table.desc(&alpha)+") for the correct results.");
00172   lambda /= 1.0E10; // convert A -> m
00173 
00174   if (alpha < 0.0)
00175         exit_on_error(command, "Negative alpha parameter (given by "+table.desc(&alpha)+").");
00176 
00177 
00178 }
00179 
00180 
00181 
00183 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00184 
00185   const clargs args(argc, argv);
00186   const AqSeries listD(args.zD_list);
00187   const AqSeries list0(args.z0_list);
00188   IPCprocess proc(listD.shape(), args.alpha, args.dist, args.dd, args.lambda);
00189   IPCexp expr(listD, list0, proc, args.contrast);
00190   expr.gamma(args.dgamma);
00191 
00192   int
00193     thetas=expr.thetas(),
00194     pixels=expr.pixels(),
00195     slices=expr.slices();
00196   const string sliceformat = mask2format(args.outmask, slices);
00197   const vector<int> sliceV = slice_str2vec(args.slicedesc, slices);
00198   const SinoS sins(expr, sliceV, args.beverbose);
00199   CTrec rec(pixels, expr.contrast(), args.nof_threads, args.filter_type);
00200 
00201   Map sinogram(thetas, pixels);
00202   Map result(thetas, pixels);
00203   ProgressBar bar(args.beverbose, "sinogram formation", sliceV.size());
00204 
00205   for (unsigned slice=0 ; slice < sliceV.size() ; slice++ ) {
00206         sins.sino(slice, sinogram);
00207         rec.reconstruct(sinogram, result, args.center(sliceV[slice]+1));
00208     CTrec::finilize(result, thetas, args.dd);
00209         SaveImage( toString(sliceformat, sliceV[slice]+1), result, args.SaveInt);
00210         bar.update();
00211   }
00212 
00213   exit(0);
00214 
00215 }
